description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f64dm","text":"This protocol details alternative method to visualize receptor dynamics in cell membranes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"etne2","text":"1. Ravelli C, Grillo E, Corsini M, Coltrini D, Presta M, Mitola S (2015) beta3 Integrin Promotes Long-Lasting Activation and Polarization of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 2 by Immobilized Ligand. Arteriosclerosis, thrombosis, and vascular biology 35 (10):2161-2171. doi:10.1161/ATVBAHA.115.306230","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4igve","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9n9b","text":"2. Andres G, Leali D, Mitola S, Coltrini D, Camozzi M, Corsini M, Belleri M, Hirsch E, Schwendener RA, Christofori G, Alcami A, Presta M (2009) A pro-inflammatory signature mediates FGF2-induced angiogenesis. Journal of cellular and molecular medicine 13 (8B):2083-2108. doi:10.1111/j.1582-4934.2008.00415.x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"agoa1","text":"The day before transfection, seed 2x104/cm2 of CHO cells in 6 well plate in F12 medium supplemented with 100 IU/mL penicillin and 100 µg/mL streptomycin and 10% FCS (complete medium) and culture under normal conditions at  in 5% CO2. When using different cell lines, ensure a cell density to allow 60-70% of confluence the day of the transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":42,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":231,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":221,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"83nc5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"364rj","text":"After  , transfect each well of CHO cells with   of pBE-hVEGFR2-eYFP and  of PEI  (1µg/µL) in serum and antibiotics free F12 medium. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eiai0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h7v2","text":"After  , replace medium with complete medium.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"elblp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"8","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":14400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8dsbv","text":"Incubate the 2 well chambered glass coverslips with   of sterile PBS containing 2 μg/mL of human VEGF-A for   at  . The coating is carried out by placing a drop containing the recombinant protein in the center of the well in order to obtain a 10 mm diameter coating spot. VEGF-A can be replaced by other ligands able to recruit other specific receptors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":57600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsda0","text":"After  , remove unbound ligand and wash the coverslips 3 times with cold and sterile PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":57600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60q2i","text":"Block nonspecific binding sites with 1 mg/mL of BSA for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5tcvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"Room temperature","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6jqve","text":"Wash the coverslips  with cold and sterile PBS. (1/3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9b69u","text":"Wash the coverslips  with cold and sterile PBS. (2/3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9edh","text":"Wash the coverslips with cold and sterile PBS. (3/3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9vko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fospo","text":"Under these conditions, ligand binds to the coverslip in a dose-dependent manner, with maximal binding at coating concentrations ≥ 2 μg/mL. Using this concentration, it is possible to have a spot with a high concentration of ligands. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff6ru","text":"Substratum-immobilized ligand is resistant to high molar salt (2 mol/L NaCl) and detergent (0.2% Triton X-100) washes [1,2].","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70od9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4du2","text":"Put glass coverslips on the bottom of a 24 well plate and ensure it remains to the bottom of the well while seeding the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4il48","text":"24 hours after cell transfection, plate CHO at the density of 75.000/cm2 in complete medium on the coverslips and culture under normal conditions for  . When using different cell lines, ensure a cell density to allow 50-80% of confluence the day of image acquisition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":71,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":150,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":57600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ljai","text":"Replace the complete medium of transfected cells with F12 (without phenol red) 1% FCS and culture under normal conditions for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":126,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fl33q","text":"After   of starvation, flip upside-down the cell-plated coverslips on immobilized-VEGF  chambered in F12 1% FCS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9qgf8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81mbc","text":"Put the sample in the microscope incubator at   and 5% CO2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":57,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2h5qj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k7mp","text":"To analyze VEGFR2 recruitment we acquired Z-stack images for  . ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"42huc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3ijb","text":"Acquire images using YFP fluorescence filter set (excitation: 500/20; dichroic: long pass 512; emission: 535/30).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58j6f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vtpg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2uqr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2fhl6","text":"CRITICAL STEP: It is very important to acquire all the images with the same camera exposure. This allows you to compare different images or different experimental conditions, when necessary.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"478A1B842E6A4E1EA7BCDFE0A53D6A29"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ecpuk","text":"Acquire imaging with a PlanApochromat 63X/1.4NA Oil objective and Apotome structured illumination that allow a sectioning of 1.3 µm. Set an overlap of 50% between two consecutive stacks. On average, a whole CHO cell is acquired in 10-12 slices, with a total thickness of acquisition of 13-15.6 µm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cmu5n","text":"Process images without deconvolution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1f7o0","text":"Open image series in Fiji as hyperstacks. A sequence of images open, each representing a stack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5r4d2","text":"Convert image stack in 8 bits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ibnk","text":"Adjust brightness and contrast in order to clearly see cells in each stack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a88b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4stq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7a6c3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"58vbs","text":"That any adjustment in brightness and contrast for the visualization won’t modify fluorescence quantification.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"39C8F565CBC54348BF601C0EE0F43AAF"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0e92","text":"In Analyze \u003e Set Measurements select Area and Area percentage options.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7v1h","text":"Open the threshold menu and set threshold manually in order to clearly see the specific fluorescence standing out from the background.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4thf0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el2a6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6kd1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dkgt4","text":"CRITICAL STEP: It is very important to set the same threshold for all the images. This allows you to compare different images or different experimental conditions, when necessary.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"239BDA57E08445D099CCA00447901569"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65tlk","text":"Draw, using freehand selection, the projection of the cell. Analyze one cell at a time. Scroll through the image sequence measuring Area and Area percentage in every stack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"evgah","text":"Save data for the analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bapdo","text":"Calculate the number of pixels positive for VEGFR2 associated fluorescence using the formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mgal","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mlok","text":"Nº of VEGFR2-positive pixels = Area percentage * (Area/100)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lp70","text":"Sum all the pixel from each Z-stack to obtain the total amount of VEGFR2-positive pixels for cell","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlvnr","text":"Calculate the distribution of VEGFR2 in each stack using the formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rod9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r61a","text":"% of VEGFR2 area = ( Nº of VEGFR2-positive pixels / total amount of VEGFR2-positive pixels) * 100","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deead","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50f8h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"52je8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5i9na","text":"That the sum of % of VEGFR2 area from all the stacks should be 100.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"EF4ED55CEB52426EBA8D5D6008999DD6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al9ba","text":"Select a region of interest (ROI) that includes one cell or more. Save the image.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"omck","text":"Create orthogonal projection by choosing, from Image \u003e Stacks the Orthogonal Views command. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"def77","text":"Create a 3D image using “3D viewer “ plugin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Alternative method to visualize receptor dynamics in cell membranes
